text: Brickellia worthingtonii is a North American species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to northern Mexico in the state of Durango.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272 Brickellia worthingtonii is a subshrub up to 60 cm (24 inches) tall. It has numerous small, nodding (hanging) flower heads.Turner, Billie Lee 1990. Phytologia 68: 92-94 diagnosis in Latin, description and commentary in English, line drawing on page 93 The species is named for US botanist Richard D. Worthington. ==References== worthingtonii Category:Flora of Durango Category:Plants described in 1990
title: Brickellia worthingtonii
